Class Professor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Professor

  • public class Professor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains graphics (draw logic and images), actions (dunk logic, score splash rendering, playing scream sound), etc for an object that will represent the Professor for the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) boolean dunked
      Used to store the objects dunk status.
      (package private) MediaPlayer scream
      This object is used to play the scream file for this person.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Professor(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String screamFile, int xPosition, int yPosition)
      Constructs a new object which represents the professor on the JPanel.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean collided(Projectile projectile)
      This method is used to indicate if the projectile has collided with the professor.
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      This method draws the professor's image to the JPanel.
      void dunk()
      This method is used to indicate that the professor has been hit and will now be in a state of being dunked.
      java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
      This method returns a rectangle which is the bounding box of the professor's image
      java.awt.Image getScoreSplash()
      Returns reference to the scoreSplash Image
      int getStartX()
      Returns starting X coordinate of the professors original position.
      int getStartY()
      Returns starting Y coordinate of the professors original position.
      java.awt.Rectangle getTargetBoundingBox()
      This is used to return the Rectangle representing the bounding box surrounding the target.
      int getXPosition()
      This method returns the professor's x coordinate on the JPanel.
      int getYPosition()
      This method returns the professor's y coordinate on the JPanel.
      boolean isDunked()
      This method is used to check if the professor is in a state of being dunked.
      void move(Pool pool, Projectile projectile, Score score, int distance)
      This method is used to modify the state of the professor game element.
      void undunk()
      This method is used to indicate that the professor is no longer dunked and should be returned to his start position .

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • dunked

        boolean dunked
        Used to store the objects dunk status. If the person has been dunked, the this will be set to true, if not this will be false.

      • scream

        MediaPlayer scream
        This object is used to play the scream file for this person.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Professor

        public Professor(java.lang.String fileName,
         java.lang.String screamFile,
         int xPosition,
         int yPosition)
        Constructs a new object which represents the professor on the JPanel.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The filename of the professor's image
        screamFile - - The filename of the scream that will be played when the professor is dunked.
        xPosition - - The professor's initial x coordinate on the JPanel
        yPosition - - The professor's initial y coordinate on the JPanel

    • Method Detail

      • collided

        public boolean collided(Projectile projectile)
        This method is used to indicate if the projectile has collided with the professor.
        Parameters:
        projectile - A reference to the object that represents the projectile.
        Returns:
        True if the projectile collided with the professor. Otherwise it returns false.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        This method draws the professor's image to the JPanel.
        Parameters:
        graphics - - A reference to the JPanel buffer

      • dunk

        public void dunk()
        This method is used to indicate that the professor has been hit and will now be in a state of being dunked.

      • getBoundingBox

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
        This method returns a rectangle which is the bounding box of the professor's image
        Returns:
        A Rectangle object which is the bounding box of the professor's image.

        Returns:

        Returns starting X coordinate of the professors original position.

        public int getStartY()
        Returns starting Y coordinate of the professors original position.
        Returns:

      • getTargetBoundingBox

        public java.awt.Rectangle getTargetBoundingBox()
        This is used to return the Rectangle representing the bounding box surrounding the target.
        Returns:
        The Rectangle object representing the bounding box which surrounds the target.

      • getXPosition

        public int getXPosition()
        This method returns the professor's x coordinate on the JPanel.
        Returns:
        The x coordinate of the professor on the JPanel.

      • getYPosition

        public int getYPosition()
        This method returns the professor's y coordinate on the JPanel.
        Returns:
        The y coordinate of the professor on the JPanel.

      • isDunked

        public boolean isDunked()
        This method is used to check if the professor is in a state of being dunked.
        Returns:
        True if the professor is dunked, otherwise it returns false.

      • move

        public void move(Pool pool,
        Projectile projectile,
        Score score,
        int distance)
        This method is used to modify the state of the professor game element.
        Parameters:
        pool - A reference to the object that represents the pool that the professor will be dunked into.
        projectile - A reference to the object that represents the projectile that the professor could collide with.
        score - A reference to the object that represents your overall score.
        distance - This effects the speed of movement of the professor.

      • undunk

        public void undunk()
        This method is used to indicate that the professor is no longer dunked and should be returned to his start position .
